title: The Sea's best kept secret: the use of seaweed as a source of biohydrogen for clean and renewable energy
content:
RSC Sustain., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D3SU00381G, Tutorial Review
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Olivia M. Wyper, Sohrab Zendehboudi, Francesca M. Kerton
Seaweeds, or macroalgae, have been used for centuries as food additives, fertilizers, and in traditional medicines. Recent uses include energy (fuels) and as a source of bioactive compounds (vitamins and fucoidan).
